New Records: Sri Lanka recorded their lowest total in T20 cricket with 77 all out in 19.1 overs.
Anrich Nortje became the first South African bowler to take four wickets in a T20 World Cup match with figures of 4/7.
Key Match Events: South Africa successfully chased down the target with the loss of four wickets in 16.2 overs.
Kusal Mendis scored 19 off 30 balls, the highest score for Sri Lanka in the innings.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was South Africa's opening game in the T20 World Cup 2024.
Sri Lanka's low total was a key factor in their loss.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's players celebrated the win with pride, highlighting the team's resilience.
The match marked a significant achievement for South Africa in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
The match was part of the T20 World Cup 2024.
